text: Santa Cecilia is an early painting by the baroque painter Artemisia Gentileschi, a painter described as "a grand exception in the history of art - a successful woman painter in an era in which art was dominated by men." The canvas was painted around 1620. It shows the saint playing a lute, with an organ, a customary attribute for her, in the background. It currently now in the Galleria Spada in Rome; it has been part of the Spada collection since the seventeenth century. == References == Category:Paintings by Artemisia Gentileschi Category:1620s paintings Category:Musical instruments in art Category:Paintings in Rome
title: Saint Cecilia (Artemisia Gentileschi)
